item.title: Computer Architecture 101
item.description: A review of basic computer architecture follows, partially inspired by linux-insides. I originally wrote this in 2016, but made edits later. Von Neumann Machines Computers today are loosely based on the von Neumann architecture as shown above, with three major components – CPU, I/O devices, and memory – connected over buses (wires). The computer works as the CPU executes instructions that either read/write to memory, or interact with I/O devices.
